nodes.bodyText:
So far, it is safe to do this in 2 steps: 1. set the parameter to null e.g. in listAsync, 2. convert the client type to wire type e.g. in listSinglePageAsync.
This relates to my decision of not overload the base method type (PagingAsyncSinglePage, SimpleAsyncRestResponse) with regard to optional parameters. Hence the init of optional parameter need to happen in other client method types.
I think v3 does it in single step, in ConvertClientTypesToWireTypes method.
Checked that following will all convert null to null, as intended.
Base64Util.encodeToString
Base64Url.encode
JacksonAdapter.createDefaultSerializerAdapter().serializeList

I am not sure what addConstant is used for in other places but taking a dependency on this field to determine whether to init the optional param might cause issues when the semantics of addConstant change. Is there a more reliable way to determine whether optional param should be initialized or not?
OK. Added ignoreParameterNeedConvert for this purpose.

bug fix.
Formatter.formatSourceAndFixImports will fail on invalid java code. It then fails the generate script on that autorest call, but not triggering error.
